title: 4-day workweek in Tokyo from next year: Is population decline reshaping Japan’s workforce?
content: Tokyo is tackling its low birth rate by offering government employees a four-day workweek starting in April. Governor Koike hopes this initiative, along with flexible work hours for parents, will encourage more families. Japan's birth rate hit a record low of 1.2 children per woman last year, far below the 2.1 needed for population stability.
summary: Tokyo is tackling its low birth rate by offering government employees a four-day workweek starting in April. Governor Koike hopes this initiative, along with flexible work hours for parents, will encourage more families. Japan's birth rate hit a record low of 1.2 children per woman last year, far below the 2.1 needed for population stability.

title: 'Writing on the wall': How Syrian teen Mouawiya Syasneh's 2011 graffiti led to Assad's downfall 13 years later
content: In 2011, 14-year-old Mouawiya Syasneh's graffiti sparked protests in Daraa, Syria, after he and his friends were detained and tortured. Public outrage over their treatment escalated into a full-blown uprising, ultimately leading to the downfall of President Bashar al-Assad and his regime.
summary: In 2011, 14-year-old Mouawiya Syasneh's graffiti sparked protests in Daraa, Syria, after he and his friends were detained and tortured. Public outrage over their treatment escalated into a full-blown uprising, ultimately leading to the downfall of President Bashar al-Assad and his regime.

title: Luigi Mangione charged with murder in UnitedHealthcare CEO Killing
content: Luigi Mangione, 26, was arrested in Pennsylvania for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Police found a 3D-printed firearm, believed to be the murder weapon, and documents suggesting anti-corporate sentiment. Mangione, an Ivy League graduate from a prominent Maryland family, was identified at a McDonald's and is facing murder charges in Manhattan.
summary: Luigi Mangione, 26, was arrested in Pennsylvania for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.  Police found a 3D-printed firearm, believed to be the murder weapon, and documents suggesting anti-corporate sentiment.  Mangione, an Ivy League graduate from a prominent Maryland family, was identified at a McDonald's and is facing murder charges in Manhattan.

title: Who is Anoushka Kale? British Indian student elected president of historic Cambridge Union
content: Anoushka Kale, a 20-year-old British Indian student, has been elected as the next president of the Cambridge Union Society for Easter 2025. Kale aims to enhance diversity and accessibility, collaborating with cultural societies and reducing event ticket prices. Her leadership comes as the Union faces financial challenges and seeks to maintain its tradition of hosting influential global figures.
summary: Anoushka Kale, a 20-year-old British Indian student, has been elected as the next president of the Cambridge Union Society for Easter 2025.  Kale aims to enhance diversity and accessibility, collaborating with cultural societies and reducing event ticket prices.  Her leadership comes as the Union faces financial challenges and seeks to maintain its tradition of hosting influential global figures.

title: Luigi Mangione’s social media activity: From anti-pornography stance to critique of modern society
content: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old University of Pennsylvania graduate and UnitedHealthcare murder suspect, held diverse political views online. He criticized modern conveniences, Japanese adult products, and societal decline, citing authors like Huxley and Kaczynski. He also advocated for traditional interactions and weightlifting, drawing parallels between contemporary America and the fall of Rome.
summary: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old University of Pennsylvania graduate and UnitedHealthcare murder suspect, held diverse political views online.  He criticized modern conveniences, Japanese adult products, and societal decline, citing authors like Huxley and Kaczynski.  He also advocated for traditional interactions and weightlifting, drawing parallels between contemporary America and the fall of Rome.

title: Polygamous sect leader in Arizona gets 50 years in prison in conspiracy to transport children for sex
content: Polygamous cult leader Samuel Bateman, 48, received a 50-year sentence for sexually exploiting and kidnapping underage girls. He pleaded guilty to transporting minors for sexual activity and kidnapping. His "wives," some as young as 9, testified about their trauma. Bateman's followers included minors and adults from troubled backgrounds.
summary: Polygamous cult leader Samuel Bateman, 48, received a 50-year sentence for sexually exploiting and kidnapping underage girls. He pleaded guilty to transporting minors for sexual activity and kidnapping. His "wives," some as young as 9, testified about their trauma. Bateman's followers included minors and adults from troubled backgrounds.

title: Inside 'Rail Force One': The trains that take world leaders to Ukraine
Trudeau survives no-confidence vote: Tories' 3rd attempt to topple Canadian PM fails
content: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau's government survived its third no-confidence vote on Tuesday. The opposition Conservatives, led by Pierre Poilievre, failed to topple the minority Liberal government. The NDP, despite recent criticism of Trudeau, sided with the Liberals, defeating the motion 180-152.
summary: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau's government survived its third no-confidence vote on Tuesday. The opposition Conservatives, led by Pierre Poilievre, failed to topple the minority Liberal government. The NDP, despite recent criticism of Trudeau, sided with the Liberals, defeating the motion 180-152.

title: McDonald's location flooded with negative reviews after alleged shooter Luigi Mangione’s arrest — Tipster targeted
content: A Pennsylvania McDonald's employee tipped off police about the presence of Luigi Mangione, a suspect in the shooting of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, leading to his arrest. Online sympathizers subsequently bombarded the restaurant with negative reviews, accusing the employee of being a "rat.
summary: A Pennsylvania McDonald's employee tipped off police about the presence of Luigi Mangione, a suspect in the shooting of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, leading to his arrest. Online sympathizers subsequently bombarded the restaurant with negative reviews, accusing the employee of being a "rat.

title: Trump selects Mark Paoletta as general counsel of the office of management and budget
content: Donald Trump has appointed Mark Paoletta as general counsel to the Office of Management and Budget for his prospective second term. Paoletta, a former White House official and lawyer, will focus on cutting government spending and advancing Trump's agenda, collaborating with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).
summary: Donald Trump has appointed Mark Paoletta as general counsel to the Office of Management and Budget for his prospective second term. Paoletta, a former White House official and lawyer, will focus on cutting government spending and advancing Trump's agenda, collaborating with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).

title: Luigi Mangione 'became quiet and started to shake' as cops confront him at McDonald's over CEO murder
content: Luigi Mangione, the prime suspect in the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, was arrested at a Pennsylvania McDonald's after a customer recognized him. Police found a 3D-printed pistol, silencer, and ammunition in his backpack. Mangione's arrest sparked online backlash, with some criticizing the tipster and others boycotting McDonald's in protest.
summary: Luigi Mangione, the prime suspect in the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, was arrested at a Pennsylvania McDonald's after a customer recognized him.  Police found a 3D-printed pistol, silencer, and ammunition in his backpack.  Mangione's arrest sparked online backlash, with some criticizing the tipster and others boycotting McDonald's in protest.

title: #FreeLuigi takes over social media: Why are people rallying behind a man arrested in CEO's murder?
content: Luigi Mangione, arrested in the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, has garnered unexpected support online. A ghost gun, suppressor, and anti-healthcare manifesto were found in his possession. Social media users, fueled by anger towards the US healthcare system, are rallying behind Mangione, viewing him as a symbol of resistance against corporate greed.
summary: Luigi Mangione, arrested in the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, has garnered unexpected support online.  A ghost gun, suppressor, and anti-healthcare manifesto were found in his possession. Social media users, fueled by anger towards the US healthcare system, are rallying behind Mangione, viewing him as a symbol of resistance against corporate greed.

title: Brian Thompson murder suspect Luigi Mangione: Heir to real estate fortune, brother to doctor, linked to Republican delegate
content: Luigi Mangione, heir to a Maryland resort fortune, has been arrested in connection with the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Apprehended in Pennsylvania, Mangione possessed a "ghost gun," silencer, and a manifesto railing against healthcare industry profits. The investigation into Thompson's December 4th shooting continues.
summary: Luigi Mangione, heir to a Maryland resort fortune, has been arrested in connection with the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.  Apprehended in Pennsylvania, Mangione possessed a "ghost gun," silencer, and a manifesto railing against healthcare industry profits.  The investigation into Thompson's December 4th shooting continues.

title: Who is Luigi Mangione, suspect in the UnitedHealth CEO shooting?
content: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old former data engineer with a privileged background, has been arrested in connection with the fatal shooting of a UnitedHealth Group executive. Police found him with a homemade gun and an anti-capitalist manifesto. Mangione's online activity reveals admiration for the Unabomber and potential struggles with chronic back pain, raising questions about his motive.
summary: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old former data engineer with a privileged background, has been arrested in connection with the fatal shooting of a UnitedHealth Group executive.  Police found him with a homemade gun and an anti-capitalist manifesto.  Mangione's online activity reveals admiration for the Unabomber and potential struggles with chronic back pain, raising questions about his motive.

title: Rupert Murdoch loses fight to change family trust
content: Rupert Murdoch's attempt to grant his eldest son, Lachlan, sole control of his media empire has been blocked by a Nevada probate commissioner. The commissioner ruled that Murdoch acted in "bad faith" when trying to alter the family trust. Murdoch plans to appeal the decision, while his other children welcomed the ruling, hoping to mend family relationships.
summary: Rupert Murdoch's attempt to grant his eldest son, Lachlan, sole control of his media empire has been blocked by a Nevada probate commissioner. The commissioner ruled that Murdoch acted in "bad faith" when trying to alter the family trust. Murdoch plans to appeal the decision, while his other children welcomed the ruling, hoping to mend family relationships.

title: Donald Trump endorses KC Crosbie after Lara steps down as RNC co-chair
content: KC Crosbie has been appointed as the new co-chair of the Republican National Committee, succeeding Lara Trump. Trump praised Crosbie's experience and commitment to election integrity. Lara Trump is considering a run for Marco Rubio's Senate seat if he is confirmed as Secretary of State. Trump commended Lara Trump's contributions to the RNC's fundraising success and strengthening of the party.
summary: KC Crosbie has been appointed as the new co-chair of the Republican National Committee, succeeding Lara Trump.  Trump praised Crosbie's experience and commitment to election integrity. Lara Trump is considering a run for Marco Rubio's Senate seat if he is confirmed as Secretary of State. Trump commended Lara Trump's contributions to the RNC's fundraising success and strengthening of the party.

title: Rebels assert control in Damascus, their plans still unclear
content: Rebel forces, Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, have seized control of Damascus, ending the Assad family's rule in Syria. Uncertainty surrounds the new leadership as Syrians return home amidst fears of retribution and lawlessness. Israel continues strikes within Syria, while Russia grants asylum to Assad. Arab nations reassess regional dynamics with Assad's ousting.
summary: Rebel forces, Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, have seized control of Damascus, ending the Assad family's rule in Syria.  Uncertainty surrounds the new leadership as Syrians return home amidst fears of retribution and lawlessness.  Israel continues strikes within Syria, while Russia grants asylum to Assad. Arab nations reassess regional dynamics with Assad's ousting.

title: Assad's PM says he has agreed to hand over power to rebels
content: Rebel leader Ahmed al-Sharaa (formerly known as Abu Mohammed al-Golani) met with Syrian Prime Minister Mohammed Jalali and Vice-President Faisal Mekdad to discuss a transitional government. Jalali agreed to transfer power to the rebel "Salvation Govt," led by Mohammed al-Bashir, who is expected to become the new prime minister. The meeting focused on ensuring continued services for the Syrian people.
summary: Rebel leader Ahmed al-Sharaa (formerly known as Abu Mohammed al-Golani) met with Syrian Prime Minister Mohammed Jalali and Vice-President Faisal Mekdad to discuss a transitional government.  Jalali agreed to transfer power to the rebel "Salvation Govt," led by Mohammed al-Bashir, who is expected to become the new prime minister.  The meeting focused on ensuring continued services for the Syrian people.

title: European countries pause asylum claims
content: Following the rebel takeover of Damascus and President Assad's flight to Russia, the UK, Germany, and Austria have paused Syrian asylum applications. Millions of Syrians, displaced by 13 years of civil war, had sought refuge in neighboring countries and Europe, including over 20,000 resettled in the UK by February 2021.
summary: Following the rebel takeover of Damascus and President Assad's flight to Russia, the UK, Germany, and Austria have paused Syrian asylum applications.  Millions of Syrians, displaced by 13 years of civil war, had sought refuge in neighboring countries and Europe, including over 20,000 resettled in the UK by February 2021.
